msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Genesis 2
ab.l: Thus the creation of the skiesand of the earth and of all their hosts was finished.
Andon the seventh day God ended his own work which he had made and he ceased|doing| on the seventh day all his work that he had made.
And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctifiedit because in it he ceased from |doing| all his work, which God had created.
These are the children of the heavens and of the earthwhen they were created: In the day |when| Lord God |created| the earth and the heavens,

And every tree of the plain: before it was in the earth,and every plant of the earth: before it grew, because the LORD God had not causedthe rain to rain on the earth, and there was no man to workthe ground,
But there went up a mist from the earthand watered the whole face of the ground:
Andthe Lord God created man of the dust of the groundand breathed into his nose the breath of life, and man became aliving being.
And earlier the Lord God planteda garden in Eden, and there he put the man whom he had created.
And the Lord God caused every tree that is comelyto the sight and good for food to grow from the ground, and the tree of lifein the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of goodand evil.
And a river went out of Eden to waterthe garden, and from there it was parted, and became fourheads.
The name of one was Pison: it was the one that encompassesthe whole land of Havilah, where there is gold.
And the gold of that land is good; there is pearl bed and theonyx stone.
And the name of the second river was Gihon:it was the one that encompasses the whole land of Cush.
Andthe name of the third river was Tigris: it was the one that goes toward the eastof Assyria. And the fourth river was Euphrates.
And the Lord God took the man, and put him into the garden of Edento work it and to keep it.
And the Lord God commandedthe man, saying, ‘Of every tree of the garden:you may surely eat their fruits.
But of the fruitsof the knowledge of good and evil: you shall not eat of it, becausein the day that you eat thereof you will have a debt of death’.
And the Lord God said,‘It is not good for the man to be alone; I shall makehim a help corresponding to him.’

Andfrom the ground the Lord God created every wild animal of the earth, and every birdof the skies, and brought them to the man to see what he would callthem. And whatever the man would call every living being, that wasits name.
And the man gave names to all livestock,and to the bird of the skies, and to all the wild animals of the field.But for the man: he did not find a help corresponding to him.
And the Lord God sent a deep sleep on the manand he slept. And he took one of his ribs, and closed upits place with flesh.
And the Lord God builtthe rib that he had taken from the man, to be a woman, and he broughther to the man.
And the man said, ‘This is nowliving bone from my bones, and body from my body:She shall be called “woman”, because it was taken from man.
On account of thisa man leaves his father and his mother and clings to his wife, andthey become one flesh.
And they were bothnaked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.

app.note: On every folio verso the last one or two lines contain one or more catchwords. They are omitted from the translation.

A mistranslation based on the confusion of Heb. מִקֶּדֶם ‘eastward’ (Gen 2:8) with Heb. מֻקְדָּם ‘former, early’. Repeated in a number of Karaim translations, observed already by Henderson (1826: 336). Translated correctly in V, R, and Kowalski (1929: 48).
